intro: Aliella ballii subsp. nitida, commonly known as the nitidleaf aliella, is a rare and delicate plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are densely covered with fine, white hairs, giving them a silvery appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers during the cooler months, typically in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found growing in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
